summary: An FBI 302 report documenting a call to the FBI National Threat Operations Center on March 8, 2021, from an individual providing information about Jeffrey Epstein. The caller reported that their ex-fiancé, who had befriended Epstein, acted as a hostess, prostitute, and model, and was involved in recruiting underage girls for Epstein, including setting up trips and meetings. The caller claimed to have saved emails and website links related to these activities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FBI report; the caller provided information pertaining to his alleged child sex trafficking activities.

events.title: FBI NTOC Call Regarding Epstein
events.description: An individual called the FBI National Threat Operations Center to report information about Jeffrey Epstein, alleging that their ex-fiancé was involved in recruiting underage girls for him.

keyFacts: The caller reported that their ex-fiancé had befriended Jeffrey Epstein and acted as a hostess, prostitute, and model, and was involved in recruiting underage girls for him.
The ex-fiancé allegedly set up trips and meetings when recruiting underage girls for Epstein and had websites under an alias name for seeking arrangements and escort services.
The caller claimed the ex-fiancé had oral sex with Epstein and saved emails documenting arrangements made for Epstein with underage girls.
An attorney representing some of the alleged victims had contacted the ex-fiancé for help, but she declined.
The caller stated they had URL links to the websites and would provide them if needed.
